This initiative aims to improve cleanliness on national highways, with each vehicle registration number eligible for one reward during the scheme's duration.

This event signals the potential end of the state's five-decade-long Maoist insurgency, following a siege of the guerrilla headquarters. The surrender bolsters the Union Home Minister's vision for a Naxal-free India.

title: Monkeys, power cuts & leaks: How India hosted chess nationals
description: While the US Chess Championship showcased professional player treatment with an umbrella for sunlight, India's National Championship faced chaos. Players endured monkeys, power cuts, and leaking tents, highlighting poor playing conditions. title: 5 everyday exercise that can help to improve heart health
description: Keeping your heart healthy is vital for overall well-being. Regular exercise strengthens your heart muscle, improves blood flow, and lowers blood pressure. Activities like brisk walking, swimming, and strength training are beneficial. Even daily movements like climbing stairs contribute to a strong heart. Consistency and safety are key to reaping these rewards and enhancing your energy and stamina.

The hub aims to accelerate AI innovation and drive growth across India by providing cutting-edge technology and local data solutions.

The decision comes amid escalating tensions and protests following the alleged casteist harassment leading to the suicide of IPS officer Y Puran Kumar.

Bihar polls: Lalu distributes tickets to RJD loyalists; Tejashwi reverses move late night
description: Despite the approaching nomination deadline for Bihar assembly elections, the Mahagathbandhan has not yet finalized its seat-sharing deal. RJD patriarch Lalu Prasad Yadav has begun distributing party tickets to favored candidates, including prominent leaders who switched parties. This move follows a similar pattern from the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, where RJD also announced candidates before a formal agreement.

Viral selfie video, arrest, party war: How Chennai murder ignited political storm in Andhra Pradesh
description: A viral selfie video of a deceased driver has reignited a political feud between suspended Jana Sena leader Vinutha Kota and TDP MLA Bojjala Sudheer Reddy. The video alleges Reddy's associates paid the driver for information on Kota, who was previously arrested and granted bail in the driver's murder case.

title: 66% of 241 MLAs in Bihar have pending criminal cases: ADR
Ghaziabad techie falls to death from 31st floor while inspecting flat
description: A 25-year-old software engineer tragically died after falling from the 31st floor of a high-rise in Indirapuram on Sunday evening. While inspecting a rental flat with his friend and a property agent, he went to the master bedroom to take a private call.

title: 'Hang them': Father of BTech grad 'beaten to death' by MP cops seeks justice
description: A BTech graduate's death following alleged police brutality has sparked outrage in Bhopal. The victim's family questions the FIR's omission of a Rs 10,000 bribe demand by constables, who are accused of assaulting the youth after he collected his degree. A murder case has been registered, and the constables arrested.

title: Roads not safe: State must pay Rs 6L for pothole, manhole deaths, rules Bombay HC
description: Bombay High Court has mandated municipal corporations and state authorities to pay Rs 6 lakh compensation for pothole-related deaths and Rs 50,000 to Rs 2.5 lakh for injuries. Committees will be formed to determine compensation, with payments to be disbursed within six to eight weeks. Strict action will be taken against responsible officers and contractors.

title: Delhi horror: Woman burns 5-year-old stepdaughter with electric iron
description: A woman in her 30s has been booked for allegedly burning her five-year-old stepdaughter with an electric iron in central Delhi. The girl's father reported the incident after finding her with severe burn injuries on her legs. The child reportedly identified her stepmother as the perpetrator.

title: Bihar polls: INDIA bloc fields Sushant Singh Rajput’s cousin Divya Gautam from Digha seat
description: Sushant Singh Rajput's cousin, Divya Gautam, a former Patna University Students' Union candidate and stage artist, will represent the INDIA bloc from Digha in Bihar's assembly elections.  The CPI-ML is fielding her against BJP's sitting MLA Sanjeev Chaurasia.  Divya, an alumna of Patna University and a PhD scholar, brings a fresh political challenge to the large Digha constituency.

title: Digital rights debate: SC rejects doctor’s WhatsApp plea; suggests using Zoho’s Arattai
description: India's Supreme Court has ruled that access to private messaging platforms like WhatsApp is not a fundamental right. The court dismissed a doctor's plea to restore her blocked account, emphasizing users must adhere to platform policies. It suggested alternatives like Zoho's Arattai app, which has seen a surge in popularity.

title: 'China using these gadgets to spy on Americans', warns US agency
description: The FCC has issued a national security notice, warning that Chinese electronics pose a surveillance and security threat to Americans. Millions of prohibited product listings, including security cameras and smartwatches from companies like Huawei and Hikvision, have been removed from US retail platforms. This action is part of Washington's ongoing crackdown on Chinese technology firms due to national security concerns.
